This is a testharness.js-based test.
FAIL Constructing a CSSLab with percent for the lightness works as intended. CSSLab is not defined
FAIL CSSLab.l can be updated with a percent. CSSLab is not defined
FAIL Constructing a CSSLab with number for the lightness works as intended. CSSLab is not defined
FAIL CSSLab.l can be updated with a number. CSSLab is not defined
FAIL Constructing a CSSLab with css pixels for lightness throws a SyntaxError. assert_throws_dom: function "() => new CSSLab(lightness, 0, 0)" threw object "ReferenceError: CSSLab is not defined" that is not a DOMException SyntaxError: property "code" is equal to undefined, expected 12
FAIL Constructing a CSSLab with degrees for lightness throws a SyntaxError. assert_throws_dom: function "() => new CSSLab(lightness, 0, 0)" threw object "ReferenceError: CSSLab is not defined" that is not a DOMException SyntaxError: property "code" is equal to undefined, expected 12
FAIL CSSLab can be constructed from three numbers and will get an alpha of 100%. CSSLab is not defined
FAIL CSSLab can be constructed from four numbers. CSSLab is not defined
FAIL Constructing a CSSLab with CSS.number for l or alpha throws a SyntaxError assert_throws_dom: function "() => new CSSLab(CSS.number(1), 0, 0, 0)" threw object "ReferenceError: CSSLab is not defined" that is not a DOMException SyntaxError: property "code" is equal to undefined, expected 12
FAIL Updating a CSSLab with CSS.number for l throws a SyntaxError CSSLab is not defined
FAIL CSSLab.l can be updated to a number. CSSLab is not defined
FAIL CSSLab.l can be updated with a CSS percent. CSSLab is not defined
FAIL Updating a CSSLab with CSS.number for alpha throws a SyntaxError CSSLab is not defined
FAIL CSSLab.alpha can be updated to a number. CSSLab is not defined
FAIL CSSLab.alpha can be updated with a CSS percent. CSSLab is not defined
Harness: the test ran to completion.
